reviews.text: Such a good restaurant. Really on of my favourites. The food is always top. Their rock shrimp is easily they best i've ever had. Everything is perfectly spiced. I would suggest asking them to bring your food out slowly as sometimes it can feel a bit rushed. The atmosphere is electric and perfect for a fun dinner. The DJ at the weekends is amazing and always brings a good vibe.

The famous Buddha Bar in Monte Carlo is one for your list.

An awesome blend of luxury and mystique.

The moment you walk in, you can lose your mind and where a towering Buddha watches over plush lounges and hypnotic trance beats.

The food menu is awesome, superb blend of Asian flavors, featuring fresh sushi, flavorful fusion dishes, and artfully presented.

The cocktails menu dazzles and worth exploring …all adding to this adventure.

Every time I visit the food is remarkable. The interior is beautiful and the music is a good volume level (upstairs, downstairs it’s quite loud). I highly recommend the rock shrimp tempura and chicken salad, or honestly anything on the menu as everything I’ve had has been a pleasure. One of my favorite restaurants here in Monaco.

The inside is beautiful with lovely ambiance and DJ playing chilled music. It is quite dark but manageable. Customer service was good from most of the staff but quite slow. I asked the waiter to make a sweet based cocktail with Rum and it tasted fantastic!! We waited an hour in the lounge before going upstairs for food. The food was a let down tbh, not worth the high price. Fried rice was hard, the Spring rolls is actually 2 cut in half and not 4 as advertised. I think you pay more for the vibe and location.

Went there multiple times already and it's amazing every time. Probably one of my favorite restaurants in Monaco. Not only for dinner it's good but also for a quick snack outside on the terrace where it's perfect to have a drink also. Food is amazing and staff is polite and professional (expect the guy at the entrance downstairs can be a bit rude sometimes).
